author: Joe Wallace
title: Turkey’s Bruised Lira Rebounds
text: One of the currencies left most bruised by the dollar’s resurgence has arrested its decline and is clawing back lost ground. Turkey’s lira gained 1.8% against the buck Wednesday, outstripping other emerging-market currencies and putting it on course for a fifth straight day of gains. It has recovered more than 6.5% since plumbing a record An Italian Euro-Exit Fear Gauge Next WSJ City PM: Europe's Banks Face an All Too Familiar Problem, What to Make of Italy's Bond Selloff
